body.p: Please use the machine in the proper environment to extend the machine's lifespan. Use the machine in a safe and stable place.

p.b: The warranty does not cover any damage resulting from reckless use or use in undesirable environments.
Place the machine in a safe place so it does not fall.

li.p: If dropped, the machine may be damaged or cause an injury.

p.b: Use the product in a clean, dust-free environment.

li.p: Otherwise, the system may not function properly.

p.b: Do not place any objects within 15 cm of the PC.

li.p: Lack of ventilation may overheat the PC from inside and put users at risk of burn injuries.

p.b: Do not store or use the PC near a magnetic object (i.e. a bag with a magnetic object, a diary, a wallet, a memo board, high-powered speakers, a bracelet, or etc.).

li.p: Otherwise, the storage device (HDD, SSD, eMMC) and the system may be damaged, and the system may fail to operate properly.

p.b: Do not use the PC on a bag with magnetic objects attached to it.

li.p: Otherwise, the storage device and the system may be damaged, and the system may fail to operate properly.

p.b: Operate the product where there is no electromagnetic interference.

li.p: Keep a proper distance between the PC and electronic appliances such as radios or speakers that generate strong magnetic fields.
Otherwise, data may be lost from the storage device (HDD, SSD, eMMC) or the LCD color may be damaged.

p.b: Do not connect a key-phone line to a wired LAN port.

li.p: A fire may occur or the product may get damaged.

p.b: If the LCD screen is damaged, do not touch LCD with your hands.

li.p: Contact the service center as it may cause an injury.

p.b: Do not leave any objects such as a pen between the keypad and the LCD.

li.p: You might break the LCD by unwittingly closing it with a foreign object remaining on the pad.

p.b: Do not press or scratch the LCD with a sharp object.

li.p: It may cause impairment.

p.b: Ensure the power is off before shutting the LCD.

li.p: The product may catch fire, be broken or deformed due to temperature rise.

p.b: Do not impose excessive force on the LCD screen or drop it.

li.p: You may break the LCD glass panel.

p.b: Do not forcibly open the LCD screen with one hand.

li.p: External impact may be inflicted on the machine.

p.b: To clean the LCD screen, use designated agents and soft cloth and rub the screen in one direction.

li.p: Too much force may damage the LCD screen.

p.b: When handling PC parts, follow the instructions in the manual.

li.p: Otherwise, the product may get damaged.

p.b: Install a vaccine program on your PC and do not download illegal programs nor access any corruptive web site such as those pushing pornographic contents.

li.p: The system may be infected and impaired.

p.b: Do not insert devices other than designated ones in the ports.

li.p: Otherwise, the product may get damaged.

p.b: Do not press the Eject button while the optical disk drive (CD/DVD/Blu-ray) is running.

li.p: The data may be lost or the disk may spin out unexpectedly to cause an injury.

p.b: Do not use a damaged optical disc (CD/DVD/Blu-ray) .

li.p: It may cause product damage or physical injury.

p.b: Avoid using a wireless LAN connection within the 5 m radius of a microwave or plasma lamp. If you have to use wireless LAN and a plasma bulb within the range, do so between channels 11 and 13.

li.p: The transmission rate may drop even if the connection is made.

p.b: Turn off the PC if you are not going to use it for an extended period of time.

li.p: It may overheat the battery.

p.b: Make sure that the memory cover is securely closed before turning on the PC.

li.p: Do not use the machine when the memory cover is open. It may damage the machine.

p.b: Please use parts certified by LG Electronics Inc .

li.p: Otherwise, a fire or product damage may occur.

p.b: Consult our service engineer before you use a peripheral device not manufactured by LG Electronics Inc.

li.p: The product may get damaged.

p.b: Handle devices and parts of the machine with care.

li.p: The product may get damaged.

p.b: Do not drop any part or device of the machine while disassembling it.

li.p: If dropped, it may be damaged and cause an injury.

p.b: Dispose of the desiccating agent and plastic wrap properly.

li.p: The desiccating agent and plastic wrap may cause suffocation.

p.b: Do not use the machine in damp places like a laundry room or bathroom.

li.p: Moisture may cause a glitch or electric shock.
Please use the machine within the appropriate temperature range (10 °C to 35 °C) and humidity range (20% RH to 80% RH).

p.b: Clean the PC with a proper agent and dry it completely before using it again.

li.p: If the PC is used while wet, an electric shock or fire may occur.

p.b: When lightning flashes in your area, disconnect the power, wired LAN and other connections.

li.p: An electric shock or fire may occur.

p.b: Do not leave a cup or other containers filled with watery substance near the PC.

li.p: In the case that liquid goes inside the PC, a fire or electric shock may occur.

p.b: If you have dropped or damaged the PC, disconnect the power and contact the local service center for a safety check.

li.p: If a damaged PC is used continuously, an electric shock or fire may occur.

p.b: Do not put a lit candle or live cigarette on the PC.

li.p: A fire may occur.

p.b: If you detect or smell smoke from the PC, stop use immediately and disconnect the power source before contacting your local service center.

li.p: A fire may occur.

p.b: As the AC adapter can be hot, do not touch it with bare skin while using it.

li.p: Extended period of exposure may cause burn.

p.b: The bottom of the PC gets hot when the system is in operation. Do not touch or put it on your lap.

li.p: Extended period of exposure may cause burn.

p.b: Do not play the PC games excessively.

li.p: Playing a PC game for an extended period of time may cause a mental disorder. It may also inflict physical impairments on the elderly and children.

p.b: Do not put your finger or an object into PC ports.

li.p: An injury or electric shock may occur.

p.b: Ask one of our engineers to run a safety check after your computer has been repaired.

li.p: Otherwise, an electric shock or fire may occur.

p.b: For minors, we recommend a program that blocks access to illegal or pornographic web sites.

li.p: Minors' exposure to adult-only contents may inflict psychological instability or even trauma on them. Take an extra precaution for your children if the whole family is using this machine.

p.b: Keep the machine away from heat-emitting devices such as a heater.

li.p: The product may get deformed or catch on fire.

p.b: Prevent children from thrusting their finger into the optical disk drive (CD/DVD/Blu-ray) tray.

li.p: The finger may be stuck in the tray and injured.

p.b: To remove an optical disc (CD/DVD/Blue-ray) from the tray, turn off the program accessing the disc and wait until the disc drive light is turned off before pressing the [Eject] button.

li.p: The optical disk spins fast inside the tray and may be ejected from the tray to cause bodily injury.

p.b: Do not block the ventilation hole with any object.

li.p: Otherwise, an electric shock may occur.

p.b: Do not leave the machine in a car.

li.p: The battery may cause an explosion or fire.

p.b: To upgrade the PC, turn off the system and disconnect the power cord and battery. If the wired LAN is connected, disconnect the network cable.

li.p: An electric shock or fire may occur.

p.b: When you upgrade the PC, ensure that children will not swallow any parts including bolts.

li.p: If a child swallowed a nut, he or she may get suffocated.
In that case, see the doctor immediately.

p.b: Do not disassemble or moderate the machine arbitrarily.

li.p: It may cause an electric shock and the customer is not entitled to request free-of-charge warranty service.

p.b: If you dissemble the PC, connect the power after reassembly is done.

li.p: Any exposed part may give you an electric shock.

p.b: Do not put in metal items such as coins, hair pin or other irons or inflammables such as paper or matches. Especially, ensure that children will not do so.

li.p: A fire or electric shock may occur.
If any foreign substance gets in the product, unplug the product and contact the local service center.

p.b: Before carrying the machine, turn off the power and disconnect all the cables.

li.p: Otherwise, you may trip over the wire, damaging the PC and sustaining an injury.

p.b: Do not carry the machine with the LCD open.

li.p: Otherwise, the product may get damaged.

p.b: Protect the machine from any shock while carrying it.

li.p: System damage or an injury may result.

p.b: Carry the product in a bag designed for it.

li.p: Carrying it in another type of bag may result in product damage.

p.b: Do not put any heavy object on the PC.

li.p: There is the risk of malfunction. If the object were to fall, it may cause an injury or damage the machine.

p.b: During air travel, follow the directions of flight attendants.

li.p: Using the PC during flight may cause an aircraft accident.

p.b: When leaving the machine in a car, avoid exposure to direct sunlight.

li.p: The product may get deformed or caught on fire due to a temperature rise.

p.b: Do not put any heavy object on the power cable and AC adapter, and avoid damage from impacts.

li.p: A malfunction or fire may occur.

p.b: Do not leave the powered-on PC in a space without enough ventilation (i.e. bags) for an extended or repeated time.

li.p: The battery may overheat and cause a fire.

p.b: When the PC is not used for an extended period of time, keep the battery level at 50%.

li.p: Do not leave the product with discharged battery for an extended period of time. It may damage the battery.

p.b: Charge the battery only with the provided instrument.

li.p: Otherwise, the battery may be damaged presenting a risk of fire.

p.b: Do not throw or disassemble the battery.

li.p: The resulting damage may cause an injury, explosion, or fire.

p.b: Use batteries certified and acknowledged by LG Electronics Inc .

li.p: Otherwise, an explosion or fire may occur.

p.b: Prevent the battery from being in contact with any metallic object like a car ignition key or a paper clip.

li.p: Otherwise, this may cause damage to the battery, a fire or burn due to overheat in the battery.

p.b: Keep the battery away from heat.

li.p: Otherwise, an explosion or fire may occur.

p.b: Do not short-circuit the battery.

li.p: Otherwise, it may explode.

p.b: Do not dispose of a spent or backup (standby) battery arbitrarily.

li.p: It may explode or cause a fire.
Disposal methods may differ by country and region. Dispose of spent batteries in accordance with the laws and safety rules of the country and region you reside in.

p.b: If you find leakage or smell bad odor from the battery, remove the battery and contact the local service center.

li.p: It may explode or cause a fire.

p.b: Do not store in places with temperatures above 60 °C and high humidity (in cars or saunas).

li.p: It may explode or cause a fire.

p.b: Keep the battery out of the reach of children or pets.

li.p: If damaged, it may cause an injury.

p.b: Keep the battery from being pierced by a sharp object or chewed by pets.

li.p: It may explode or cause a fire.

p.b: Do not put the battery in water.

li.p: Otherwise, the battery may be damaged or explode.

p.b: Do not use the PC on top of carpet, blanket or bed. Also, do not put the adapter under the blanket.

li.p: This may cause a malfunction, fire or burn due to overheat in the PC and adapter.

p.b: Read the battery usage precautions carefully before use.

li.p: Keep the battery at the room temperature. Refer to Tips in LG Easy Guide and Installation Guide to use and store the battery properly.

p.b: Ensure that the power jack linked to the AC adapter and product is connected firmly.

li.p: Loose connection may cause malfunction or fire.

p.b: Do not bend the power cable for AC adapter too much or get stamped by a sharp object.

li.p: The wires inside the cable may break and cause electric shock or fire.

p.b: Do not use loose plugs or damaged power cords.

li.p: An electric shock or fire may occur.

p.b: Do not touch the power cord with your hands wet.

li.p: Otherwise, an electric shock may occur.

p.b: Pull the plug, not the cord, to disconnect the AC adapter and power jack.

li.p: Otherwise, a fire or product damage may occur.

p.b: Operate the product at the proper voltage.

li.p: Excessive voltage may result in damage on the product, electric shock or fire.

p.b: Use power outlets with an earth pin installed and proper supply of rated electricity.

li.p: An electric leakage may cause an electric shock or fire.
The shape of the power cord and outlet may differ by country and region.

p.b: Plug the power cord tightly into the outlet.

li.p: Loose connection of the power cord may cause a fire.

p.b: In the case of strange noise from the cord or plug, disconnect the power cord from the outlet immediately and contact the service center.

li.p: A fire or electric shock may occur.

p.b: Use the power supply/adapter provided with the product and never disassemble the product.

li.p: Using a different product or disassembling it may cause an electric shock or fire.

p.b: Ensure that the power outlet is earthed before plugging in.

li.p: Otherwise, an electric shock from power leakage may occur.

p.b: Always keep the AC adapter and power outlet clean.

li.p: A fire may occur.

p.b: Keep children and pets from damaging the power cord.

li.p: It may cause a fire or an electric shock.

p.b: Disconnect the PC completely before cleaning it.

li.p: Otherwise, an electric shock or impairment may occur.

p.b: If the power/AC adapter or the product is soaked, disconnect the battery, power/AC adapter, and all other lines before contacting the local service center.

li.p: An electric shock or fire may occur.

p.b: When installing the battery, be sure that the bottom of the PC is locked in place.

li.p: Otherwise, the battery may be damaged.

p.b: Handle the machine with care to prevent loss of data from the storage device (HDD, SSD, eMMC).

li.p: Since the storage device is fragile, you need to back up your important data frequently.
The manufacturer is not responsible for any storage device data loss caused by a user's mistake.

p.b: Damage to the storage device (HDD, SSD, eMMC) and data loss may occur when:

li.p: External shocks are inflicted on the machine while disassembling or installing it.
The machine is reset (i.e. restarted) or turned on again after a power outage while the storage device is operating.
The PC is infected with a virus, tainting the data irrecoverably.
Abrupt turning-off of the PC can damage the PC.
If the product is moved, shaken or exposed to external shock while the storage device is running, file damage or bad sectors may occur.

p.b: To minimize data loss resulting from storage device damage (HDD, SSD, eMMC), frequently back up important data.

li.p: The manufacturer is not responsible for any data loss.

p.b: We do not refund or replace a product that malfunctions due to the installation or use of an operating system other than the one provided by LG Electronics Inc.

li.p: Some software applications may not work properly in other operating systems. Such malfunctions are not covered by the warranty.
